title: How to Make Your Phone Vibrate: Complete Guide

steps.title: Open the Settings app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open the Settings app on your iPhone. It's the gray gear icon on your Home screen or in your App Library . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Go to Sounds & Haptics.
steps.content: Go to Sounds & Haptics . It has a red speaker icon. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Turn on Play Haptics in Ring Mode.
steps.content: Turn on Play Haptics in Ring Mode . Turning this option on will make your iPhone vibrate when it's set to Ring Mode. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Turn on Play Haptics in Silent Mode.
steps.content: Turn on Play Haptics in Silent Mode . Turning this option on will make your iPhone vibrate even when it's set to Silent Mode. [4] X Research source Turning both of these options on means your iPhone will vibrate at all times (unless you’re in Do Not Disturb or in certain Focus Modes ). To turn vibration back off , tap either of these options again.

steps.title: Swipe down on the screen.
steps.content: Swipe down on the screen. Starting at the top of your Samsung phone's screen, swipe down to open the quick settings menu. [5] X Research source If you’re still getting started with your device, see our guide on how to activate your cell phone .

steps.title: Tap the sound options button.
steps.content: Tap the sound options button. This icon will be either the mute, sound, or vibrate symbol.

steps.title: Cycle through the options until you reach the Vibrate setting.
steps.content: Cycle through the options until you reach the Vibrate setting. Each press will cycle your sound through these three options. The vibrate icon looks like a speaker with a line through it with a wavy line to the right. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Press one of the physical volume buttons.
steps.content: Press one of the physical volume buttons. This will open a volume slider on the right-side of the screen. [7] X Research source Use this method if your Android is not a Samsung Galaxy model. If you have a Samsung, see this method instead.

steps.title: Tap the Ring icon.
steps.content: Tap the Ring icon. It’s a small bell.

steps.title: Tap the Vibrate icon.
steps.content: Tap the Vibrate icon. It’s a rectangle with vertical lines on either side. This will turn on vibrate for your Android. [8] X Research source Changing the notification settings, like vibration, is a great way to control your cell phone use .

steps.title: Open the Shortcuts app on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open the Shortcuts app on your iPhone. If you want to create a continuous vibration effect on your iPhone, you can do so in the Shortcuts app. This shortcut will repeat a vibration pulse for a specified amount of loops. You'll find the Shortcuts app on your Home screen or in your app library. [9] X Research source Check out our iPhone shortcuts guide to learn about more cool things you can do with the Shortcuts app.

steps.title: Tap the + icon in the top right to start a new Shortcut.
steps.content: Tap the + icon in the top right to start a new Shortcut.

steps.title: Search for and select Vibrate.
steps.content: Search for and select Vibrate . A list of options will appear.

steps.title: Select Vibrate Device.
steps.content: Select Vibrate Device . Another set of options will appear. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Tap, hold, and drag Vibrate Device.
steps.content: Tap, hold, and drag Vibrate Device. Move it between Repeat and End Repeat .

steps.title: Increase the number of loops.
steps.content: Increase the number of loops. Tap 1 time next to repeat. Then tap the + icon in the pop-up menu to increase the number of times the vibration pulse will occur. Your custom vibration Shortcut is complete! Tap the play button (the triangle icon) to run the shortcut.

steps.title: If you want your Android or iPhone to vibrate continuously for a period of time, you can try a vibration app.
steps.content: If you want your Android or iPhone to vibrate continuously for a period of time, you can try a vibration app. Whether you want to play a prank or work out some muscle pain, you can find an app that will persistently make your phone vibrate. Download a vibration app. Go to the App Store (iPhone) or Google Play Store (Android) to find a vibration app for constant vibration. These apps have good reviews and high ratings: iMessage U Vibrating Massager (iPhone) Vibrator Strong: Vibration App (Android)
